questions.question: The Japanese Occupation started in ____ and ended in ____.
Which of the following is true of Singapore just before the Japanese Occupation?

choices.answer: There were few locals in the government.
The governor of Singapore was a local.
There were no locals in the government.
The British were in charge of Singapore.

questions.question: People in Singapore felt that they would be safe from a Japanese invasion because...

choices.answer: the British had a large naval base in Singapore.
big guns were installed along Singapore's coasts.
the British were the most powerful empire in the world.
the British were famous for their naval power.

questions.question: How did people in Singapore feel when the British fell to the Japanese after 8 days?

choices.answer: "Despite the defeat, the British are still a superior race."
"We should not see the British as a superior race anymore."
"The British made promises they could not keep."
"Let's welcome the British back when the war ends."

questions.question: To promote "Asia for the Asians", the Japanese promised to...

choices.answer: let locals rule their own country, under Japanese guidance
dispel the myth of the "white man's" superiority
spread the idea that Asians were just as good as Europeans
cooperate with local Malays and Indians

questions.question: Which of the following describes how Eurasians and Europeans were treated by the Japanese?

choices.answer: They swept roads and did repair work.
They helped the Japanese to maintain order on the streets.
They helped to build the Death Railway.
They were given enough food in Prisoner of War camps.

questions.question: The Japanese promoted their culture in schools by making students...

choices.answer: sing the Japanese National Anthem during morning assembly
read Japanese comic books and cartoons
do gardening and cleaning because they promoted Asian values
learn Japanese instead of English Language.

questions.question: Which of the following accounts describe what life was like for most people under the Japanese?

choices.answer: "Life was good. The Japanese treated everyone fairly."
"We did not have enough to eat. It was a terrible time."
"We had to show respect to the Japanese everywhere we went."
"I was paid with rare banana notes, which were valuable."

questions.question: The Kempeitai were...

choices.answer: the Japanese military police
Japanese suicide bombers
people who used force to remove anti-Japanese locals
local military police

questions.question: During Operation Sook Ching,

choices.answer: Chinese men were checked for being anti-Japanese
only Chinese men aged 18 to 50 were checked
all those who were checked were killed
those who were suspected of being anti-Japanese were killed

questions.question: People lived in fear during the Japanese Occupation because...

choices.answer: they could be accused of being anti-Japanese by an informer
there were local informers who worked for the Japanese
they would be tortured if accused of being anti-Japanese
they had no way of knowing who was an informer

questions.question: Some of the economic hardships experienced by people during the Japanese Occupation were...

choices.answer: food rationing, to control the sale of essential items
expensive prices for food on the black market
the loss of value of Japanese banana notes
many job opportunities

questions.question: The price of rice per kati (0.6kg) was $0.50 in Dec 1942. What might its price be in Dec 1945?
The two main anti-Japanese groups in Singapore during the war were...

choices.answer: The Anti-Japanese League
The Malayan People's Anti-Japanese Army (MPAJA)
The Singapore Anti-Japanese Resistance
Force 136

questions.question: After the war, the British returned and set up the British Military Administration (BMA) to...

choices.answer: govern Singapore forever.
restore peace and stability in Singapore until 1965.
grant Singapore independence on 9 August 1965.
govern Singapore until 1 April 1946.

questions.question: The BMA struggled to tackle 4 main problems after the war. Which is not one of them?

choices.answer: insufficient food and existence of black market
disruption of trade and businesses
insufficient schools, teachers and textbooks
shortage of water

questions.question: When the civilian government took over from the BMA, people were still unhappy. They decided to

choices.answer: join trade unions to fight for better working conditions
participate in strikes to force employers to pay them more
participate in protests to make their unhappiness known
participate in riots to vent their frustration

questions.question: The Maria Hertogh riots broke out because people were unhappy that...

choices.answer: the British judge unfairly sided with Maria's Dutch parents
Maria's Dutch parents wanted Maria back
Maria did not like Che Aminah
Che Aminah was insensitive to Maria's wishes

questions.question: The three growing demands that people had on the British colonial government were:

choices.answer: demand for citizenship
demand for better jobs and salaries
demand for local political involvement
demand for better treatment of local civil servants

questions.question: Even though the British started recruiting more locals into the civil service in 1948,

choices.answer: well-qualified locals were treated worse than the British.
the locals had better opportunities than the British.
the British civil servants still enjoyed higher salaries.
British civil servants had less benefits than the locals.
